column4: hm, i figured when you produce a flash file in linux it would be identical to the file produced by a windows flash, mac and windows have that in common
flash always banks on working perfectly cross platform
hm, maybe i should find a cheap second pc to try it out on first before putting it on my main machine
nope, i'm gathering as much info as i can before doing anything
what is the live cd exactly?
i know i should look this stuff up, there's just so much ubuntu info i'm trying to read everything at once
ah, i'll check that one out, seems convenient
thanks guys, i'll do some reading and try the live cd
with a password, or are you connected once you plug the cable?
wine is a compatibility layer for Linux. Lets you run windows programs in Linux.
what kind of internet connection do you have?
right. Try out the live cd. I think you'll like it. There are irc clients available and you shouldn't have any difficulties connecting.
just boot from live cd, install wine and install your Flash Studio or whatever it is called.
keep in mind that the system will be much slower because you're running from the cd.
